Hello Again EF team. 
I'm wonder that validator index or pubkey can be matched with fee recipient address.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
They can be matched once you created a block post-merge, since the fee recipient is part of the ExecutionPayload.
Btw this discord is all ethereum researchers and devlopers, not only EF

author: johnydony
content:
Oh that's my mistake. 
Thank you for pointing out. 
I mean  can I get the information about pair of validator info with its fee recipient address through beacon chain api?

Or any other api??

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
No not yet, it's a n:n relationship. I don't think you'll see RPC apis popping up for this.
My guess is that indexing services (etherscan, beachchain) will probably create something for this

author: alexssd7fp
content: Also, there are no specific fee addresses for validators. The fee recipient address is provided upon the proposal of the block. In fact, a single validator may use any address as a fee recipient, no matter anything.

author: alexssd7fp
content: Beacon chain is not specifying nor enforcing the fee recipient address.
